alert.note: Alert for Kauai North; Kauai Southwest; Maui Central Valley North; Maui Windward West; Molokai North; Molokai West; Molokai Windward; Niihau; Oahu North Shore; Waianae Coast; Windward Haleakala (Hawaii) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: High Surf Advisory issued October 18 at 3:44PM HST until October 19 at 6:00AM HST by NWS Honolulu
info.description: ...HIGH SURF WARNING CANCELLED FOR NORTH AND WEST FACING SHORES OF NIIHAU KAUAI OAHU MOLOKAI AND NORTH FACING SHORES OF MAUI... ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT FOR FOR NORTH AND WEST FACING SHORES OF NIIHAU KAUAI OAHU MOLOKAI...NORTH FACING SHORES OF MAUI...AND WEST FACING SHORES OF THE BIG ISLAND... .The large northwest to north-northwest swell (320-330 degrees) has gradually lowered today with surf now below High Surf Warning thresholds. Advisory level surf is expected to hold through tonight for most north and west facing shores of the smaller islands as well as west facing shores of the Big Island. Advisory level surf may linger into Thursday for exposed shorelines of the smaller islands, but should drop below advisory thresholds by Thursday evening statewide. ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 AM HST THURSDAY... ...HIGH SURF WARNING IS CANCELLED... * WHAT...Surf 18 to 24 feet along north facing shores and 12 to 16 feet along west facing shores. * WHERE...North and west facing shores of Niihau, Kauai, Oahu, Molokai, and north facing shores of Maui. * WHEN...Until 6 AM HST Thursday. * IMPACTS...Moderate. Strong breaking waves and strong currents will make swimming dangerous. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...
info.instruction: Head all advice from ocean safety officials. When in doubt, don`t go out.
